page.title: 06EXPERIMENTAL BASE CAMBORNE
page.content: {Rosewarne Experimental Station}is situated on the A.30 Hayle Dual Carriageway. It was built in{l951}and employs 45 people whose wages range from{Â£5000 per year to Â£15000}.There are{20 experimental stations}in Britain, seven of them are horticultural and thirteen are Farming Stations. The Rosewarne Station is a horticultural station and it specialises in Daffodils, lillies and many other flowers. Some vegetables are grown also e.g. cauliflower, cabbage,potatoes,carrots etc. Altogether the station owns 112 acres, 100 of which are cultivated. The remaining l2 acres have buildings on them.{Five 'O' levels}are required to work in the Admin Block.{A degree in {Horticulture and Biology}is needed to work in the{scientific area.}No qualifications for{farm work.
